quick.q: Who is the recipient and what's your relationship?
quick.purpose: Set appropriate tone based on relationship (boss, peer, direct report)

quick.q: What's the purpose of this email? (inform, request, respond, update)
What's the key information or ask?

complex.q: Who are the recipient(s) and what's the context of your communication?
What's the primary goal of this email?
What background information do they need?
complex.purpose: Determine how much context to provide

complex.q: What are the key points you need to make? (Aim for 3-5 max)
What specific action or response are you requesting?
Are there any sensitive issues to navigate carefully?
Will there be attachments? If so, what?
What tone is most appropriate for this situation?

blog.q: What's your central message or thesis?
Why does this topic matter right now? Why should readers care?
What do you want readers to think, feel, or do after reading?
What evidence, examples, or data supports your message?
Are there any stories, case studies, or personal experiences to include?
What are the main counterarguments, and how do you respond to them?
blog.purpose: Strengthen the argument by addressing objections

blog.q: How should this open? (Hook, context-setting, anecdote, question)
What are the 3-5 key sections or points to cover?
How should it close? (Call-to-action, reflection, forward-looking statement)
Who's the primary audience and what's their technical level?
What tone is most appropriate? (Authoritative, conversational, inspirational, analytical)

social_linkedin.q: What's your main point in 1-2 sentences?
Who's your target audience for this post?
What tone? (Informative, thought-provoking, inspirational, conversational, urgent)
What action do you want readers to take? (Comment, share, click link, reflect)
Will you include a link or visual? If so, to what?

social_twitter.q: What's your main point in one ultra-concise sentence?
What tone? (Witty, serious, informative, provocative, casual)
Is this a single tweet or a thread? If thread, how many tweets?
Will you include a link? To what?

report.q: What is the purpose of this report?
Who are the primary and secondary audiences?
What decisions will this report inform or influence?
What's the scope? What's explicitly out of scope?
What are the main findings or conclusions?
What supporting data, metrics, or evidence do you have?
What trends or patterns emerged from your analysis?
Were there any surprises, anomalies, or unexpected findings?
What structure would work best? (Executive summary first, chronological, problem-solution, etc.)
Will you need visualizations? (Charts, graphs, tables)
How much detail is appropriate for this audience?
Are there specific formatting requirements? (Template, brand guidelines, page limit)
Is there sensitive or confidential information to handle carefully?
What's the deadline and who will review this before it's finalized?
